page.title: 05CRESWELL CRAGS
page.content: Immediately to the south of the limestone quarry is Creswell Crags, a limestone gorge with a pond and a stream running through it. There are lots of caves in the limestone cliffs. Robin Hood's Cave is the largest one and the other main caves are Pin Hole Cave, Church Hole Cave, Boat House Cave and Mother Grundy's Parlour. Stone Age Man lived in these caves thousands of years ago and their tools and implements have been found here. The bones of bison, woolly rhinoceros, horses, hyenas and bears have also been found in the caves. Creswellian Man did not paint on the walls of their caves but made carvings on animal bones instead. There is a good exhibition of all these historical finds in the Crags Visitor Centre.
